Lack enough support: The expert questions the claim's support by asking for more information about the projections and verifying the figures independently.
Problematic assumption: The expert questions the assumption that entitlement spending alone will consume all revenue by 2045, suggesting that it may not be a valid assumption.
Exist alternative explanation: The expert explores alternative explanations by considering the potential roll-off in federal money and the risk of sticking Ohio with unaffordable costs.
Understate: The claim may be understating the national debt figure, as it was slightly higher than the mentioned $16.4 trillion at the time the claim was made.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the national debt was already over $16.4 trillion at the time the claim was made.
Exaggerate: It is unclear if the claim exaggerates the potential impact of entitlement spending on consuming all federal revenue by 2045, as the expert questions the validity of the projections.
